title: Complementary therapy
author: Healthdirect Australia
description: Complementary therapy, sometimes called alternative therapy or integrative medicine, is often used alongside conventional medicine.
cleaned_text: [ ](/acupuncture) Acupuncture Acupuncture is a Chinese medicine treatment. Practitioners use needles to stimulate points in the body to help in the treatment of some conditions. [ ](/chinese-traditional-medicine) Chinese traditional medicine Based on ancient practices, traditional Chinese medicine uses techniques such as acupuncture, tai chi, herbal medicines and other mind body practices. [ ](/chiropractors-chiropractic-treatment) Chiropractors and chiropractic treatment Chiropractors use therapies, such as chiropractic manipulation and massage, to treat and prevent musculoskeletal problems like back and neck pain. [ ](/homeopathy) Homeopathy This article briefly describes homeopathy, including the lack of current evidence for its effectiveness and safety. [ ](/massage-therapy) Massage therapy guide Through manipulating the body's soft tissues, massage therapists can help manage a range of conditions. There are many types of massage. [ ](/relaxation-techniques-for-stress-relief) Relaxation techniques for stress relief With practice, relaxation can help you calm down and take a step back from stressful situations. Follow the tips here. [ ](/health-benefits-of-yoga-and-pilates) Health benefits of yoga and Pilates Learn what yoga and Pilates involves and how they can improve your health and wellbeing, such as preventing back pain and relieving stress.
